title: Weird creature in Murang’a, Kenya? No, another silicone sculpture by Italian artist Laira Maganuco
author: africacheck.org
vclaim:
on Facebook in Kenya for some time.

two photos of a four-legged human-faced creature on a Facebook group page with close to 2 million members.

photo shows the creature on all fours, claws on bare ground and scales on its back, staring straight into the camera. The

the photo. Murang’a is a town 75 kilometres northeast of Nairobi, Kenya’s capital.

Since the photos were posted on 6 April 2019 they’ve been shared 350 times and have attracted about 1,400 reactions and 800 comments.

They were also posted on Nigeria’s

in October 2018, described as “an unknown human-faced creature seen in an erosion site”.

Around the same time a YouTube channel posted a

of the creature saying it was an “animal with human face found in Gujarat Village – India”.

But as Africa Check has found with

, the photos aren’t of any living thing.

They show one of the many sculptures crafted out of silicone – a rubbery and lifelike material used to make

Similar sculptures can be seen on her

Maganuco describes this particular sculpture as a armadillo-human

on her YouTube channel shows that the rubbery silicone makes the sculpture seem to have lifelike movements when shaken off camera.

The sculpture is for sale on creative goods retail site

. Here Maganuco says it was “carved entirely by hand in acetic silicone paste”.
